modules.description: This module defines configuration options for an IRC client using Lwt and SSL, specifically controlling certificate verification and specifying the SSL protocol version. It provides a `default` value that sets up a standard configuration with safe defaults. Concrete use cases include initializing a secure IRC client connection with customizable SSL settings.

This module handles secure network communication for IRC clients using Lwt and SSL. It provides functions for connecting to servers, sending and receiving messages, and managing SSL-encrypted streams. It works with IPv4 and IPv6 addresses, and uses a configuration type to set up connection parameters like host, port, and SSL settings.

This module implements an asynchronous IRC client over SSL, managing secure connections with automatic reconnection and keepalive. It centers around the `connection_t` type, offering operations to send IRC commands like JOIN and PRIVMSG, and handle incoming messages via Lwt-based async I/O. The configuration module sets SSL parameters such as certificate verification and protocol version, with a ready-to-use default setup. The network module connects to servers, sends and receives encrypted messages, and supports both IPv4 and IPv6, integrating with the main client logic to build secure, persistent IRC bots or clients.
